searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimChain.new( animators: {Spring | Tween }?-- A list of animators to add to the chain ) → AnimChain-- The constructed AnimChain object Constructs a new AnimChain object.

searchDocs.title: AndThen​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimChain:AndThen( callback: () → ()-- The callback to execute ) → AnimChain-- The current AnimChain object Links a callback to be executed after all animations in the chain have completed.

searchDocs.title: Await​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimChain:Await() → AnimChain-- The current AnimChain object Yields the current thread until all animations in the chain have completed, then returns the current AnimChain object.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Quaternion.new( w: number,-- The scalar part of the quaternion v: Vector3 -- The vector part of the quaternion ) → Quaternion-- The constructed Quaternion object Constructs a new Quaternion object from a given scalar value and vector

searchDocs.title: fromCFrame​
searchDocs.content: </> Quaternion.fromCFrame( cframe: CFrame -- The CFrame to convert to a Quaternion ) → Quaternion-- The constructed Quaternion object Constructs a new Quaternion object from a given CFrame Originally sourced from the wiki (source no longer available):http://wiki.roblox.com/index.php?title=Quaternions_for_rotation#Quaternion_from_a_Rotation_Matrix

searchDocs.title: fromOrientation​
searchDocs.content: </> Quaternion.fromOrientation( orientation: Vector3 -- The Orientation (in degrees) to convert to a Quaternion ) → Quaternion-- The constructed Quaternion object Constructs a new Quaternion object from a given Orientation (in degrees)

searchDocs.title: Inverse​
searchDocs.content: </> Quaternion:Inverse() → Quaternion-- The inverse of the quaternion

searchDocs.title: AxisAngle​
searchDocs.content: </> Quaternion:AxisAngle() → ( Vector3 , number )-- The axis and angle of the quaternion

searchDocs.title: Slerp​
searchDocs.content: </> Quaternion:Slerp( target: Quaternion,-- The target quaternion to interpolate towards alpha: number-- The alpha value to interpolate by (0-1) ) → Quaternion-- The interpolated quaternion Returns a quaternion interpolated by the alpha value between this one and the target

searchDocs.title: ToCFrame​
searchDocs.content: </> Quaternion:ToCFrame() → CFrame -- The CFrame representation of the quaternion

searchDocs.title: ToOrientation​
searchDocs.content: </> Quaternion:ToOrientation() → Vector3 -- The Orientation (in degrees) representation of the quaternion

searchDocs.title: ControlPoints​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline.ControlPoints: {CFrame } A table of CFrames that are used as control points for the spline curve

searchDocs.title: Curve​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline.Curve: Model  A model containing the parts that make up the spline curve. This is updated whenever the control points are moved or the Segments property is updated

searchDocs.title: Destroying​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline.Destroying: RBXScriptSignal  Fires when the spline curve is destroyed.

searchDocs.title: Parent​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline.Parent: Instance?  The parent of the spline curve model. Default workspace.

searchDocs.title: Segments​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline.Segments: number The number of segments per curve. The higher this number, the more accurate the curve will be, but the more expensive it will be to calculate. Default 10.

searchDocs.title: Visible​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline.Visible: boolean Whether or not the spline curve is visible in the workspace. Default false.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline.new( controlPoints: {CFrame }-- The control points for the spline. ) → Spline-- The new Spline object. Constructor for the Spline class. Takes in a curve model and returns a new Spline object.

searchDocs.title: GetCFrameFromAlpha​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline:GetCFrameFromAlpha( alpha: number,-- The alpha value to get the point at. This should be a value between 0 and 1. alignment: ("Track" | "Nodes")?-- This will orient the rotation of the result to either follow the rotation of the path ("Track") or the rotation of the nodes ("Nodes") ) → CFrame -- The CFrame along the curve at the given alpha value using the segments for distances. Gets a CFrame along the spline at a given alpha value using the natural Catmull-Rom spline algorithm.

searchDocs.title: GetLinearCFrameFromAlpha​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline:GetLinearCFrameFromAlpha( alpha: number,-- The alpha value to get the point at. This should be a value between 0 and 1. alignment: ("Track" | "Nodes")?-- This will orient the rotation of the result to either follow the rotation of the path ("Track") or the rotation of the nodes ("Nodes") ) → CFrame -- The CFrame along the curve at the given alpha value using the segments for distances. Gets a CFrame along the spline using a close approximation to where the point would be linearly to a given alpha value using the Catmull-Rom spline algorithm.

searchDocs.title: Destroy​
searchDocs.content: </> Spline:Destroy() → () Destroys the spline curve and cleans up any listeners.

searchDocs.title: Springable​
searchDocs.content: </> type Springable = Vector3 | Vector2 | number | UDim2 | UDim | CFrame | Color3

searchDocs.title: Position​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.Position: Springable Returns the current position of the spring

searchDocs.title: Velocity​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.Velocity: Springable Returns the current velocity of the spring

searchDocs.title: Target​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.Target: Springable Returns the target of the spring

searchDocs.title: Damper​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.Damper: number Returns the damper of the spring, defaults to 1. [0, 1]

searchDocs.title: Speed​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.Speed: number Returns the speed of the spring, defaults to 30. [0, infinity)

searchDocs.title: Clock​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.Clock: number Returns the clock function used to track time

searchDocs.title: Type​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.Type: string Returns the type of value being tracked

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring.new( initial: Springable,-- The starting position of the spring. clock: (() → number)?-- function to use to update spring ) → () Creates a new spring.

searchDocs.title: Impulse​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:Impulse( velocity: Springable-- The velocity to impulse with ) → () Impulse the spring with a change in velocity

searchDocs.title: TimeSkip​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:TimeSkip( delta: number-- The amount of time to skip forward in seconds ) → () Skips the spring forward by the specified amount of time

searchDocs.title: Bind​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:Bind( label: string,-- The label to bind the callback to. callback: ( position: Springable, velocity: Springable ) → ()-- The callback function to bind ) → () Binds a callback function to the given spring's position and velocity. Can be used to create more complex and constant interactions with spring values than just a quick impulse or target.

searchDocs.title: Unbind​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:Unbind( label: string-- The label to unbind the callback from. ) → () Unbinds the given callback label from the spring.

searchDocs.title: IsAnimating​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:IsAnimating( epsilon: number?-- The epsilon value to use for determining if the spring is animating. Defaults to 0.0001. ) → ( boolean, Springable )-- Whether or not the spring is animating, and the current position. Returns whether or not the spring is animating, and the current position.

searchDocs.title: Destroy​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:Destroy() → () Cleans up any bindings.

searchDocs.title: Disconnect​
searchDocs.content: </> Spring:Disconnect() → () Alias for :Destroy()

searchDocs.title: SpringInfo​
searchDocs.content: </> interface SpringInfo { Position: Springable? Velocity: number? Target: Springable? Damper: number? Speed: number? Initial: Springable? Clock: (() → number)? } A dictionary of spring properties such as {s = 10, d = 0.5}. Can be constructed using any keys that you could use to create a Spring object. Possible keys: Initial = Initial | i Speed = Speed | s Damper = Damper | d Target = Target | t Velocity = Velocity | v Position = Position | Value | p Clock = Clock

searchDocs.title: TweenInfoTable​
searchDocs.content: </> interface TweenInfoTable { Time: number? EasingStyle: Enum.EasingStyle? EasingDirection: Enum.EasingDirection? RepeatCount: number? Reverses: boolean? DelayTime: number? } TweenInfo can be passed to the tweening functions as either a TweenInfo object or a dictionary of the desired parameters. Keys are either the TweenInfo parameter name or shortened versions: Time = Time | t EasingStyle = EasingStyle | Style | s EasingDirection = EasingDirection | Direction | d RepeatCount = RepeatCount | Repeat | rc Reverses = Reverses | Reverse | r DelayTime = DelayTime | Delay | dt

searchDocs.title: tween​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.tween( object: Instance | {Instance },-- The object or objects to apply the tween to. tweenInfo: TweenInfo | TweenInfoTable,-- The tween information or a table of tween parameters. properties: {[string]: any}-- A dictionary of properties to tween to. ) → AnimChain-- An AnimChain representing the tween. Asynchronously performs a tween on the given object. Tween parameters are identical to TweenService:Create(). AnimNation.tween(part, TweenInfo.new(2, Enum.EasingStyle.Quad, Enum.EasingDirection.Out), { Position = Vector3.new(10, 20, 30), Rotation = Vector3.new(45, 90, 0), }):Await()

searchDocs.title: tweenFromAlpha​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.tweenFromAlpha( objects: Instance | {Instance },-- The object or objects to apply the tween to. tweenInfo: TweenInfo | TweenInfoTable,-- The tween information or a table of tween parameters. properties: {[string]: any},-- A dictionary of properties to tween to. alpha: number,-- The alpha percentage to start from (0-1). yield: boolean?-- Whether to yield until the tween is complete. ) → () Asynchronously performs a tween on the given object, starting from the specified alpha percentage. Otherwise identical to AnimNation.tween. AnimNation.tweenFromAlpha(part, TweenInfo.new(2, Enum.EasingStyle.Quad, Enum.EasingDirection.Out), { Position = Vector3.new(10, 20, 30), Rotation = Vector3.new(45, 90, 0), }, 0.5)

searchDocs.title: getTweenFromInstance​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.getTweenFromInstance( object: Instance -- The object to get the tween from. ) → Tween? -- The last tween played on the object. Returns the last tween played on the given object, or nil if none exists.

searchDocs.title: lerp​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.lerp( object: Instance | {Instance },-- The object or objects to apply the lerp to. tweenInfo: TweenInfo | TweenInfoTable,-- The tween information or a table of tween parameters. properties: {[string]: any},-- A dictionary of properties to lerp to. alpha: number-- The alpha percentage to lerp to (0-1). ) → () Instantly set the given object's properties to a lerped value between its current state and the given properties. Functions like .tweenFromAlpha(), except that it doesn't continue to play the tween. Naturally, the time value used in the provided TweenInfo or table has no effect on this function. Currently supports number, Vector2, Vector3, CFrame, Color3, UDim2, UDim and any other type that supports scalar multiplication/addition. AnimNation.lerp(part, TweenInfo.new(1, Enum.EasingStyle.Quad, Enum.EasingDirection.Out), { Position = Vector3.new(10, 20, 30), Rotation = Vector3.new(45, 90, 0), }, 0.5)

searchDocs.title: impulse​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.impulse( object: Instance | {Instance },-- The object or objects to apply the impulse to. springInfo: SpringInfo,-- A table of spring properties such as {s = 10, d = 0.5}. properties: {[string]: any}-- A dictionary of properties to apply impulses to. ) → AnimChain-- An AnimChain representing the spring animations. Asynchronously performs a spring impulse on the given object. AnimNation.impulse(part, { s = 15, d = 0.7 }, { Position = Vector3.new(10, 20, 30), Rotation = Vector3.new(45, 90, 0), }):Await()

searchDocs.title: target​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.target( object: Instance | {Instance },-- The object or objects to apply the target to. springInfo: SpringInfo,-- A table of spring properties such as {s = 10, d = 0.5}. properties: {[string]: any}-- A dictionary of properties to target. ) → AnimChain-- An AnimChain representing the spring animations. Asynchronously uses a spring to transition the given object's properties to the specified values. AnimNation.target(part, { s = 15, d = 0.7 }, { Position = Vector3.new(10, 20, 30), Rotation = Vector3.new(45, 90, 0), }):Await()

searchDocs.title: bind​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.bind( springs: {Spring},-- A table of springs to bind to. label: string,-- A unique label to identify this bind. callback: ( positions: {Springable}, velocities: {Springable} ) → ()-- The function to call on each update. ) → () Binds a callback function to the given springs' position and velocity. Can be used to create more complex and constant interactions with spring values than just a quick impulse or target. AnimNation.bind({ spring1, spring2 }, "MyBind", function(positions, velocities) print("Spring 1 Position:", positions[1], "Velocity:", velocities[1]) print("Spring 2 Position:", positions[2], "Velocity:", velocities[2]) end)

searchDocs.title: unbind​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.unbind(label: string) → () Unbinds the callback associated with the specified label from updates.

searchDocs.title: createSpring​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.createSpring( springInfo: SpringInfo,-- A table of spring properties such as {s = 10, d = 0.5}. name: string?-- An optional name for lookup with AnimNation.getSpring(). ) → Spring-- The newly created spring. Creates a new spring with the given properties. local mySpring = AnimNation.createSpring({ s = 10, d = 0.5 }, "MySpring")

searchDocs.title: getSpring​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.getSpring( name: string-- The name of the spring to retrieve. ) → Spring-- The spring with the given name. Returns the spring with the given name.If none exists, it will return nil with a warning, or an error depending on the set ERROR_POLICY. local mySpring = AnimNation.getSpring("MySpring")

searchDocs.title: createSpline​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.createSpline( controlPoints: {CFrame },-- A table of CFrame control points with at least 4 entries. name: string?-- An optional name for lookup with AnimNation.getSpline(). ) → Spline-- The newly created spline. Creates a new spline from the given control points. This should be a table of CFrame values with at least 4 entries. Optionally allows you to provide a name for lookup with AnimNation.getSpline(). local mySpline = AnimNation.createSpline({ CFrame.new(0, 0, 0), CFrame.new(5, 10, 0), CFrame.new(10, 0, 0), CFrame.new(15, 10, 0), }, "MySpline")

searchDocs.title: getSpline​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.getSpline( name: string-- The name of the spline to retrieve. ) → Spline-- The spline with the given name. Returns the spline with the given name. If none exists, it will return nil with a warning, or an error depending on the set ERROR_POLICY. local mySpline = AnimNation.getSpline("MySpline")

searchDocs.title: slerpTweenFromAlpha​
searchDocs.content: </> AnimNation.slerpTweenFromAlpha( object: Instance ,-- The object to perform the slerp tween on. tweenInfo: TweenInfo | TweenInfoTable,-- A TweenInfo or table describing the tween parameters. splineInfo: Spline | {CFrame },-- A Spline object or table of CFrame control points. alignment: ("Track" | "Nodes")?,-- Optional; whether to align to the track or nodes. Defaults to "Nodes". alpha: number?,-- Optional; the starting alpha percentage (0-1). Defaults to 0. yield: boolean?-- Optional; whether to yield until the tween is complete. Defaults to false. ) → () Asynchronously performs tween-based spherical interpolation on the given object, starting from the specified alpha percentage. Parameters are similar to AnimNation.tweenFromAlpha(), with the addition of alignment which determines whether the object being tweened is aligned to the track orientation or the nodes' orientations. A spline argument is also required, which can be supplied as previously constructed Spline object or an array of points to create a new one from. Currently supports number, Vector2, Vector3, CFrame, Color3, UDim2, UDim and any other type that supports scalar multiplication/addition. AnimNation.slerpTweenFromAlpha(part, { t = 2, s = Enum.EasingStyle.Quad, d = Enum.EasingDirection.Out, }, { CFrame = AnimNation.createSpline({ CFrame.new(0, 0, 0), CFrame.new(5, 10, 0), CFrame.new(10, 0, 0), CFrame.new(15, 10, 0), }), }, "Track", 0.25, true)
